message_1: What is the degree of the Fano variety defined by the hypersurface equation $x_0^{d}+x_1^{d}+x_2^{d}+x_3^{d}=0$ in $\mathbb{P}^3$ for $d=5$?
message_2: The degree of a hypersurface in projective space is the degree of its defining polynomial. In this case, the defining polynomial is $x_0^5 + x_1^5 + x_2^5 + x_3^5 = 0$. Since the highest degree of any monomial in this polynomial is 5, the degree of the hypersurface, and thus the degree of the Fano variety, is 5.
